common_confusions: Do not assume Ga orthography or pronoun forms identical to Akan/Twi forms; the Ga guide uses its own tables and examples.
Avoid treating abbreviations or editorial marks in older grammars as canonical orthography for modern training targets.
strict_rules: Follow Ga guide orthography for vowels and digraphs exactly as presented (gaguide_2.pdf, Vowels and Digraphs sections).
Respect tone marking conventions in the Ga grammatical sketch; tones are inherent in each syllable and are marked in examples where needed (Zimmermann, 1858, pp.10â€“12).
When extracting pronoun forms, use them as examples tied to the guide and avoid asserting them as the only canonical forms if the source shows variation (gaguide_2.pdf, Pronouns section).
